statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Sacramento St. 74, N. Colorado 70
article.story: GREELEY, Colo. (AP) -- Haron Hargrave scored 22 points and Alex Bausley added 15 points and eight rebounds as Sacramento State ended a three-game losing streak with a 74-70 victory over struggling Northern Colorado Saturday night. Loren Leath also had 14 points for Sacramento State (6-8, 1-1 Big Sky), which had lost six consecutive road games and six straight conference games before beating Northern Colorado. Sacramento State hit six 3-pointers to extend its streak of consecutive games with at least one 3-pointer to 361. Kirk Archibeque had a season-high 24 points to go with seven rebounds to lead Northern Colorado (2-12, 0-2). Sean Taibi had three 3-pointers for the Bears, losers of four straight. Archibeque scored Northern Colorado's first eight points of the second half, but Hargrave had two 3-pointers as Sacramento State maintained a 49-40 lead five minutes into the period. Alonzo Young's layup and free throw made it 54-47 before UNC's Taibi scored the next seven points to tie it at 54. Leath buried three jumpers and two free throws over a three-minute stretch to put Sacramento State up 67-61, but Darren Moore accounted for four of the next five points to pull Northern Colorado within 67-66 with 4:05 remaining. Two free throws by Hargrave and three by Bausley made it 72-69 before Justin Williams' dunk sealed the game with nine seconds left. Sacramento State used a 17-4 run and a suffocating man defense to lead 40-32 at the half. Northern Colorado trailed 9-7 after two free throws by Archibeque five minutes into the game, but Hargrave began the run with a 3-pointer and finished it with a layup with 7:10 left that moved the Hornets ahead 26-11.
